explanation:
CHAT_PAGE — You must see the definition/initializer, type and size/length of CHAT_PAGE (e.g. "static const char CHAT_PAGE[] = ..." or "#define CHAT_PAGE ..." or declaration as a pointer). strlen(CHAT_PAGE) will scan memory until a terminating '\0'; to determine if that scan can overrun the object you need the exact object layout, storage duration and whether a terminating NUL is guaranteed (or whether the symbol is e.g. an array with an explicit size that might omit the terminator).

strlen — Although strlen is a standard library function, the project may provide its own implementation or macro. You need the strlen declaration/implementation used in this translation unit to confirm its scanning semantics (it must stop at the first '\0' and not read past object bounds) and to ensure no wrapper redefines it to unsafe behavior.

MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static — The call uses the strlen result as the length argument. To judge whether passing strlen(CHAT_PAGE) is correct or may interact with later accesses beyond the object bounds, you need the function prototype/semantics: does it expect the length to include or exclude the terminating NUL, does it copy or reference the buffer, and does it later access bytes past the provided length (which could expose a problem if strlen mismeasured). Knowing how this API consumes the buffer is necessary to assess overall out-of-bounds risk.
